name: Mark Tercek
text: ...plant trees, do more R&D, etc. Since bending carbon curves is hard, any increment helps. But that does not justify any action. The *strategy* required is to make the choices that offer *the biggest abatement the fastest.* Any distraction from this is counterproductive.

name: Mark Tercek
text: You should. "All of the above" is the antithesis of strategy, which requires making clear choices and then driving hard whereever those choices take you. There is an IPCC analog: All the curves show that we have to do everything--stop coal, but also go vegan, go negative...//t.co/PU583hWCft

name: Mark Tercek
text: With that - I've always loved Serena and I now love and feel so hard for Naomi. I love being a strong woman, but I also appreciate the people in my life (especially my Tweeps!) who empower and support me. We can all learn from this and become better over time.

name: Mark Tercek
text: Encourage her thoughts, encourage her passion, and encourage her enthusiastic expression of what she thinks is right. Cut her some slack, and don't give her another reason to doubt herself.

name: Mark Tercek
text: The next time you see a woman express her emotions, passion or enthusiasm for a topic, embrace it and empower it. Remember that regardless of how you respond, she'll probably play that moment back and wonder if she was too aggressive or too much.

name: Mark Tercek
text: And that's exactly what happened to Serena last night. And it sucks for both Serena and Naomi. And the whole world now has the opportunity to learn from this.

name: Mark Tercek
text: It's hard, it's constant, and sometimes we can't do both. Sometimes we don't have patience, we're tired of having to think before acting, exhausted from picking up the the slack. Once in a while, we lose it, and we pay the consequences.

name: Mark Tercek
text: Women are continually told to lean in, speak up, stop apologizing, be clear and ask for what you want. But we're also told to be cooperative, be kind, be a team player and be a good role model to others.

name: Mark Tercek
